optimized_sql: WITH ctr_all AS (SELECT sr_customer_sk AS ctr_customer_sk, sr_store_sk AS ctr_store_sk, SUM(SR_FEE) AS ctr_total_return FROM store_returns JOIN date_dim ON sr_returned_date_sk = d_date_sk WHERE d_year = 2000 GROUP BY sr_customer_sk, sr_store_sk), store_avg AS (SELECT ctr_store_sk, AVG(ctr_total_return) * 1.2 AS avg_return FROM ctr_all GROUP BY ctr_store_sk) SELECT c_customer_id FROM ctr_all AS ctr1 JOIN store ON ctr1.ctr_store_sk = store.s_store_sk JOIN customer ON ctr1.ctr_customer_sk = customer.c_customer_sk JOIN store_avg ON ctr1.ctr_store_sk = store_avg.ctr_store_sk WHERE store.s_state = 'SD' AND ctr1.ctr_total_return > store_avg.avg_return ORDER BY c_customer_id LIMIT 100
hint: Apply scalar subquery-to-join. Ignore EXISTS conversion.
